ygData.subject: Re: A couple questions..
ygData.msgSnippet: ... nay, wizards are not the only class here... just the loudest! ... actually that is not completely correct.  you are only stuck there if you rely completely
ygData.messageBody:
--- TRAVISL <TRAVIS@...> wrote:
> From: TRAVISL <TRAVIS@...>
>
> Hello everyone. I play a level 4 mage (seemingly the
> only class on this
> mailing list)
> >>>I am a level9 Shaman!

nay, wizards are not the only class here... just the loudest!

> and I have a few questions about spells and such.
> Sorry for the
> list, but it's the easiest way to get it across.
> 1. Since you can only use Bind Affinity at level 12,
> are you basically stuck
>
> in your home town until then? I find this hard to
> believe, since warriors
> might not be able to cast it, but some people have
> said this to be true.
> >>>That is correct. But, you are not limited to
> staying at home, just limit
> how far you go in your travels. If that's Erudin,
> then yeah, maybe you are
> stuck at home.

actually that is not completely correct. you are only stuck there if
you rely completely on yourself. Others can cast Bind Affinity upon
you. If your travels take you across the ocean, try to find a
high-level wizard to Bind you there. You spell-slingers all get along
pretty well, don't ya?

> 2. I started training in piercing, and lately I've
> seen most fellow Eruditescarrying staffs or clubs.
> Was this a mistake? Does it even matter latter on,
> as you'll be fighting in a group and not using melee
> weapons?
> >>> I think that is right too. At higher levels you
> wont care about melee
> at all I think. Then again, I've never played a
> wizard. My shaman can
> fight melee pretty well.

Circumstances and your personality will dictate what you need. If
you're a powergamer, then go to one of the EQ sites and check out the
stats. I think most eventually prefer staves, but if you're not as
worried about the numbers you might just want to stick with the dagger.
Otherwise you've blown your investment...

> 3. Hey, where's the music?!
> >>> I think I've heard that music is only set up for
> SBLive and "SoundFont"
> cards. However, I saw a post that they will soon
> release a patch so it
> works with other sound cards as well.
>
> That's all. Any help will be greatly appreciated.
>
> Izin

I heard the same thing. I understand it's currently available on the
Test Server... and they could always use more help.

Jantis
